ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: Mystic Alliance has become a rather large and (thanks to some delicious idiots trying to stir up trouble that backfired complete) rather well known. We have
ygData.messageBody:
Mystic Alliance has become a rather large and (thanks to some delicious
idiots trying to stir up trouble that backfired complete) rather well known.
We have been averaging 15 people at night at any one time. We have had a
lot of new people join lately, and hope to keep growing. :)
I think we have something like 25 active members currently. We are trying
to work up a current members list to figure out how many people we really
have!





----- Original Message -----
From: "Terry Walker" <mellowtigger@...>
To: <EQ_rainbow@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 30, 2001 5:40 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] Hello


> >Yes I believe Rodcet is the largest collection of players
>
> I'm curious what a "large collection" means in "gay EQ" terms. I keep
trying
> to compare our new guild with the uber-guilds on The Nameless server and
of
> course we come up short. But we usually have around 4 people online, with
as
> many as 10. Last weekend, I think, we grouped with our guildfriends (The
> Nameless of Mercy) at SolA and we had enough people to completely fill 2
> party groups. I think that's an exceptional headcount for a guild that's
> still less than half a year old.
>
> Cure my feelings of inadequacy as guildleader. Tell me we're doing well
on
> the "headcount" test. Heh.
>
> - SoulDreamer, Nameless Love guild, The Nameless server
>
>
>
>
>
